Result.Title: Object identity as a query language primitive

Result.Abstract: Lore (for Lightweight Object Repository) is a DBMS designed specifically for managing semistructured information. Result.Title: Lore: a database management system for semistructured data

Result.Title: Representing and querying XML with incomplete information

Result.Title: Non-deterministic languages to express deterministic transformations

Result.Title: Fixpoint logics, relational machines, and computational complexity

Result.Abstract: Most recursive extensions of the first-order queries converge around two centralclasses of queries: fixpoint and while. Infinitary logic (with finitely many variables) is avery powerful extension of these languages which provides an elegant unifying formalismfor a wide variety of query languages. However, neither the syntax nor the semantics ofinfinitary logic are effective, and its connection to practical query languages has
Result.Title: Computing with Infinitary Logic
